oai_dc:dc.dc:title: World War I Memorial for Corporal Roby Hendrix
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Memorial for Corporal Roby Hendrix who was killed in World War I. The image features a painting of advancing troops, light and heavy artillery, tanks, naval personnel, ships, and airplanes around a central image of a battered pillar and a poem. It also shows the British, French, and Italian flags at the top and the words "In Loving Remembrance" on the bottom right corner. The notation "copyright 1918 - H. F. Wendell, Leipsic, Ohio" appears in the lower left corner.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Broadsides
Broadsides; World War, 1914-1918; Poetry; War Poetry, American; World War, 1914-1918 - Poetry
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Corporal Hendrix was a member of Company G of the 117th U.S. Infantry Regiment, 30th Division. The 30th Division was engaged in action from the end of September through late October 1918 during an attack on the Hindenburg Line. The October 8 assault on Premont was the most difficult and caused the most casualties.
